work.name: Zenjob
work.summary: Zenjob, based in Berlin, Germany, matches over 20,000 talents with 12,000 part-time jobs from over 1,000 companies every month. The platform empowers the workforce of tomorrow, enabling part-time jobbers to decide when, where, and how to work with just a few clicks.
highlights: Directed a team of 4 engineers in the implementation of a fully automated order management system, which resulted in a significant rise in automation from 75% to 98%, substantially minimizing the requirement for human intervention.
Overhauled the front-end Authentication system of the B2B application, transitioning from Redux to React Context, resulting in increased robustness.
Executed the development of a bulk order submission system, enhancing the process efficiency and significantly simplifying its usage.
Devised a Talent Rating process, accommodating multiple complexities, including.
Spearheaded the initialization, implementation, and migration of end-to-end tests from TestCafe & Cypress to Playwright, enhancing both stability and coverage.
Engineered an internal panel to streamline the daily tasks of account managers, replacing a VBA tool with a user-friendly React application.

work.name: eLamp
work.summary: Involved in eLamp’s early stages as a student, we started from the founders’ couch. Despite challenges, we built a successful product, leading to eLamp’s acquisition by a larger group in 2023.
highlights: Shaped a startup’s tech direction from inception, building a robust front-end tech stack with TypeScript, React, and GraphQL.
Developed complex user interfaces and data visualization tools with React and D3JS.
Created features for a user-friendly product, focusing on aesthetically pleasing designs and functional animations.
Ensured software quality through rigorous testing methodologies, maintaining high standards for our products and reducing bugs by 30%.
Improved site load time by 15% by implementing advanced caching techniques.
